comments.commentBody: The CIA and FBI are not militias. The CIA is supposed to be an information gathering agency and the FBI an investigative agency. The fact that you and probably many others think these organizations are militias is further evidence of our violence-obsessed entertainment industry's success in disinforming the public.

I recommend that the CEO and CFO, board of dirctors, and major funders of Smith and Wesson, Glock, and the NRA be forced to go to this elementary school clean the floors, walls, rugs, desks, books, clothes, posters, holiday ornaments, and so forth from blood of these innocent people. Then come back to us and say you are still in the gun business.

If only he had just been trying to buy Sudafed.  They make that so impossible no one attempts treating a head cold with it any longer.  No Sudafed for you, but all the guns you can lay your hands on to slaughter innocent children and condemn their parents to a living hell every day they must endure their horrific loss.
Thank you so much for your insights. Indeed, not only the need for gun control, but the unaddressed needs of our mentally ill, call out for attention in the wake of this tragedy.

William, the USA has the most lax gun regulations of any of the OECD nations -- and the highest rate of deaths by gunfire.  Anyone can get a gun. Anyone can buy ammunition -- as much ammunition as he wants and as many guns as he wants.

The makers of guns have wrapped their economic interests in the american flag, declaring their products a symbol of patriotism and liberty. They mask their profiteering by pretending to honor the peoples' rights, remaking the founders' intentions to promote their commercial interests. They corrupt our nation's politics with pulsing waves of money that tether our representatives to their largess, all to protect and expand their money-making machinery against the greater good and safety of our children.

Evil was indeed visited upon a small town today. And evil will return soon enough. It will not stop and it will never stop until the people reclaim their right to peace and security by exposing the perpetrators of this industrial complex of death. We need only open our eyes to see that these emperors wear no clothes.

And to those who would look away, cluck their tongues, urge us to control our baseless fear and suggest we conspire to steal their rights, I ask a single question....

Did you lose your 5 year old child to a bullet today?

Enough!  There are 300 million people in this country and an estimated 300 million guns in the hands of citizens.  No "sportsman" needs an assault rifle or a 20 cartridge magazine.  To hell with the NRA and gun lobby.  We need to do something now.  This is not what the founding fathers had in mind when they authored the second amendment.
it is troubling that someone could be so mentally diseased.  But it's awfully hard to drive your car through a school and kill 30 people.

How many more will have to die, each day, how many more children will be taken down by guns? As a mother of a 9 year old, I am crying as I write, when i think about the devastating, bottomless grief these parents must be going through. At times when most families are shopping for Barbies and Nintendos, they will be deciding which coffin to use for their child.

Why? Why? For a 200 year old Constitution? Or to satisfy the bottomless greed of the NRA and the arm industry? Ban guns from America, for God's sake!

If this isn't the time for debating gun control, when is the time? This year there were the shooting in Colorado, the shooting at the Sikh temple and now this. How many more mass killings do we want to witness before we decide enough is enough?

We can't just always blame the shooter who may be dead and get over with it! We can't wait for another such event, blame the shooter again and wait even more! How many innocent lives should we sacrifice?

Yes, guns don't kill people, people do. So if guns cannot be banned, ban each and every person who has gun from any public places because that person has a weapon which he or she can use to kill innocent folks!
"Automatic" or "semi-automatic" is always the description of the weapon in these instances of mass murder.
Actually, they are used for personal protection . . . by law enforcement officers and individuals who hold permits to carry them.

The time has long ago come for action.  Where is the "Occupy" movement to occupy the headquarters of the NRA and the offices of all the politicians who support them?  The profiteers in the gun business, their advocates,and the craven, cowardly officials who empower them, all have the blood of innocents on their hands.  How can they sleep at night?  How can they celebrate Christmas or Hanukkah, knowing that dozens of families have lost loved ones today because of their murderous complicity with the gun lobby.?  How can they live with themselves?  This President and this congress must take step to limit the sale and possession of all gun, or we must get rid of them all and replace them with men and women of true courage, conviction, and humanity.

Words cannot describe emotions. What can explain this...nice little kids. Any amoun of weeping and talking is not going to bring their life back.

One thing for sure. Americans have to realize the danger of freely licensing guns. Look at Asian countries and learn. People don't walk around with guns in Asia. Stop this madness rightaway. Your democratic rights should not be understood to mean right to carry guns. That's nothing short of madness. You are putting destructive power in the hands of mad people (like this shooter) and this is what happens.

Remember these beautiful little kids and for their sake stop licensing guns and forfeit the ones already out in the public. We don't want to hear such stories again.

The Newtown CT school shooting. How horrific. Day in day out, the horror is repeated.

Two years ago a friend was murdered, and a year later another friend's grandmother, father and uncle were killed by one of the in-laws.

I wrote my state legislators, the governor, and attorney general asking them to do something. The typical response was 'if you have a legislative idea, I'll be glad to take a look'.

If I have an idea? Hell yes I have an idea. Make the manufacturer's liable for all the costs when their guns are used to kill people. What other legal product is there that by design will be used to kill or injure? Make them pay.
Look at the other developed countries. The most effective high tech gear in the handle of a gun is that that has no gun around it. Stop selling guns to anyone.

It was terrible, but until congress can get out from under the NRA and other special interests in the gun business nothing much will happen. Maybe not even if the NRA supported bringing back the assault weapons ban that expired in 2004. And many NRA members support that and reasonable gun control regulations. Has anyone done a comparison in how many more deaths per incident occurred before and after 04? The availability of high capacity clips?

A gov buyback of guns? Who would ever want to just sell their guns to the gov? I wouldn't.

But it would all be easier than trying to change laws dealing with the 1st Amendment. It's even more sacred than the 2cd. Citizens United vs any gun controls??

Thank you for an excellent letter. You nailed it exactly about the 1780's perspective on the Second Amendment being applied in ridiculous, dangerous ways today. I fear, however, that the NRA will never budge; its members will never budge; and politicians will remain beholden to the NRA. We as a society are, indeed, being held hostage by the NRA.
Your plan would work in an ideal world, but not one in which only law-abiding citizens obey the law, including gun laws.  Criminals would end up as the group with all the guns.

About lunchtime, my son called. "The police say an entire class is missing." We knew the numbers but how could an entire class of children be missing?.

Today an entire American kindergarten class was shot to death.

I hope every American adult is as stunned as I am realizing this is the legacy of our thirty years of tolerance and indifference to guns slaughtering our children in school and the rest of us in public places.

Why does a 1780's notion of an armed public deterring a tyrant trump the right of all of us being safe from slaughter by 21st century firearms?

The lasting picture is going to be the boy at edge of the woods, covering his mouth with his hands but his eyes fixed back at the school, his mother's arm hardly around him - ineffectively protecting, comforting, or taking him out of his reality.

Adults failed - again.

We've got gun laws protecting gun owners but not effective gun laws protecting the public.We know what's needed. It's also time to limit annual gun sales and Institute a massive, generous, government buyback and destruction of guns.

We need open access to public mental health treatment without stigmatization and publicly funded treatment of mental disorders that threaten the community.

We need sustained condemnation of violent entertainment media.

Today brought the extreme, heart-breaking result of our gun-violence tolerance. It's time for the grown ups to take over and create the gun-safe environment we want for ourselves and our children.
Most of this violence occurs by legally owned guns
Sanity

While I agree that the war on drugs has had little effect on drug use (other than to make drug selling immensely profitable), I don't think the analogy is apt.

First, gun purchases are relatively rare. An adict will make dozens or hundreds of drug purchases a year and even casual users make many. The average gun fancier makes only a handful in a lifetime.

Second, guns are not addictive or even habuitating in anything like the way drugs are. This means the average gun buyer is probably far more price sesitive than the average drug buyer. If prohibition made guns, say, 3 times as expensive, I'd bet the number of purchases would drop by something like 80%.
What would happen if we had a war on illegal weapons and illegal possession of weapons instead of a war on drugs?

This turned out to be an easy Saturday for me. The NW started quickly and by the time I got to CHANDLER ARIZONA it became a runaway.

There seem to be some posting bugs now. Spinning wheels and strange messages are showing up. I honestly don't know if my first paragraph here duplicates a previous attempt.

Rijk. I love the idea of a recommendation rampage, but my recco to you here still went to your post of 10:21. When I undid it and tried again, it just disappeared altogether.

Groan.
The politicians who have cut your counseling resources down to nothing are the same ones who refused to renew the assault weapons ban. Connect the dots, please.

So I hear on the news Kindergarten teacher should reassure children that they are safe". That will make the children feel better. But we the adults know that it is simply NOT TRUE. Until we the adults change the climate, availability, restrictions, qualifications, or the amendment itself, our children are NOT SAFE. Let this massacre count for something change our laws. Write, phone, tweet, protest make changes to protect our youngest. It is our duty.

With the long history of these mass shootings, I find it amazing that no owner or person associated with gun manufacture, CEO, CFO, lobbyist,  has ever stepped forward and apologized to the public.   They are obviously unrepentent for their greed and the blood on their hands.  I am disappointed that the New York Times and other members of the press have not revealed the identities of these interesting"human beings.  Who are you protecting from whom?  Maybe they would be more cooperative in creating a solution if they knew that people knew who the responsible parties are.
In fact, regular people are not allowed to own automatic weapons.
